|vendor_id = 0156 |device_id = 0002 |subvendor_id = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |subdevice_id = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |id_string = <!-- PnP ID string --> |windosid = <!-- Windows ID, Leave blank for none --> |fcc_id = IMRWLPC24 |icid = 2301021343A |boardid = <!-- Board ID --> |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id --> |oui = 00:60:1D
|chip1 = Lucent;HERMES I;WCND (C) 1998, HERM C010827A, 1257H, 9916S 3638240; |chip2 = Lucent;THESEUS M;LUCENT, WCND (C) 1998, TH-M 010318, 1178AE2, 9915S23253402; |chip3 = Philips;; |chip4 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; -->

|linuxdriv = none |windriv =
|is_manuf = No |manuf = <!-- Manufacturer --> |manuf_model = <!-- Manufacturer Model --> |manuf_rev = <!-- Manufacturer Revision --> |addchip = IF quadrature transceiver;Philips;SA1630;SA1630BE, 016742, FP026B;1;;LQFP-48; ,,, 2.4GHz low-voltage RF transceiver (w/ LNA + mixer);Philips;SA2420;SA2420DH, THAILAND, GMM5730, 9909n-;1;BiCMOS;TSSOP24; ,,, Low-voltage frequency synthesizer for radio telephones (900 / 2GHz);Philips;UMA1021M;MA1021, MQ3025, MSJ9142, TAIWAN;1;BiCMOS;SSOP16; ,,, Parallel Flash memory (1 Mbit);Atmel;AT29C010A-70TC;ATMEL, AT29C010A, 70TC, 9913;1;;TSOP32; ,,, RAM chip;EliteMT;LP62S1024V-55LL;;1;<!-- ,,, 2058MHz to 2138MHz VCO;Murata;MQG101-2098;101, 2098, *93 (M;1; ,,, VCO;Murata;MQE901-704;901, -704, (M D93;1;--> |flags = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |802dot11_protocols = legacy (DSSS) |accessible_UART = No |accessible_JTAG = |category =

}}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== This card is recognized in Windows as a... *'''<small>PCMCIA\Lucent_Technologies-WaveLAN/IEEE-0156-0002</small>''' *'''<small>PCMCIA\Lucent_Technologies-WaveLAN/IEEE-C908</small>'''
These devices would not seem to work with '''orinoco_cs''' when using the stock firmware. :The non-working unit had PRI 2.04 ('''P1020401.HEX''') and STA 3.04 ('''S1030400.HEX'''). .. however, upgrading the firmware to PRI 4.00 ('''P1040000.HEX''') and STA 6.06 ('''S1060600.HEX''') - using the WLW2K601 driver set and its included firmware ('''WSU10606.EXE''') - managed to get the device working w/ '''NetStumbler''' in WinXP and w/ '''orinoco_usb''' (monitor mode worked, scanning worked, and un-encrypted WiFi to an 11b AP worked <small>in all of its 2Mbps glory</small>).
===Additional information, per Lucent's product brief=== The product brief for the 2Mb WaveLAN/IEEE models was found [http://ftp.gwdg.de/pub/misc/wavelan/docs/IEEE/BROCHURE/ENGLISH/E_I3ePC.pdf here].
{{802dot11 RxSens|11b |2M=-90 |1M=-93 }}
